quizzes.question: C# applications run:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Welcome to C#[/h1]

C# is an elegant object-oriented language that enables developers to build a variety of secure and robust applications that run on the [b].NET Framework. [/b]
You can use C# to create Windows applications, Web services, mobile applications, client-server applications, database applications, and much, much more. 
[note]You will learn more about these concepts in the upcoming lessons![/note]

quizzes.question: Which one is NOT part of the .NET Framework?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The .NET Framework[/h1]

The .NET Framework consists of the [b]Common Language Runtime (CLR)[/b] and the .NET Framework [b]class library[/b].
The [b]CLR [/b]is the foundation of the .NET Framework. It manages code at execution time, providing core services such as memory management, code accuracy, and many other aspects of your code.
The[b] class library[/b] is a collection of classes, interfaces, and value types that enable you to accomplish a range of common programming tasks, such as data collection, file access, and working with text.
C# programs use the .NET Framework class library extensively to do common tasks and provide various functionalities.
[note]These concepts might seem complex, but for now just remember that applications written in C# use the [b].NET Framework[/b] and its components.[/note]
